params.owner: The user who has given the allowance.
params.spender: The user who was given the allowance.

returns._0: The amount of tokens `spender` can transfer on `owner`'s behalf.

params.amount: The amount of tokens that are being added to the allowance.
params.spender: The address that is receiving the allowance.

returns._0: A boolean which is true if the operation succeeded.

params.owner: The address whose balance is being retrieved.

returns._0: The number of tokens owned by the user.
A string with the name of the token.
A string with the symbol of the token.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred.
params.to: The address that will receive the tokens.

returns._0: A boolean which is true if the operation succeeded.

params.amount: The number of tokens to transfer.
params.from: The address that owns the tokens that are being transferred.
params.to: The address that will receive the tokens.

returns._0: A boolean which is true if the operation succeeded.

allowance(address,address).notice: Returns how many tokens a user has allowed another user to transfer on its behalf.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Allows users to provide allowance to other users so that they can transfer tokens on their behalf.

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the balance of a user.

decimals().notice: Retrieves the number of decimals used by the token. The default is 18.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().notice: Retrieves the name of the token, e.g. "Synthetix Network Token".

symbol().notice: Retrieves the symbol of the token, e.g. "SNX".

totalSupply().notice: Returns the total number of tokens in circulation (minted - burnt).

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfer tokens from one address to another.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Allows a user who has been given allowance to transfer tokens on another user's behalf.
